data.title: Jdrama Weblog
data.text:
Scarlet

Date: From 8.00 a.m., Mondays – Saturdays, 30 September 2019

Station: NHK

Scriptwriter: Mizuhashi Fumie (Haha ni Naru, Hayami-sensei Kekkon Surutte Hontou desu ka?, Sharehouse no Koibito)

Cast: Toda Erika, Kitamura Kazuki, Tomita Yasuko, Sakuraba Nanami, Fukuda Mayuko, Sato Ryuta, Oshima Yuko, Hayashi Kento, Zaizen Naomi, Magy, Mizuno Miki, Mizobata Junpei, Kimoto Takehiro, Hano Aki, Mitsubayashi Kyoko, Nishikawa Takanori, Matsushita Kohei, Issey Ogata, Kuroshima Yuina, Ito Kentaro

Synopsis: Shortly after the end of the war, Kawahara Kimiko (Toda Erika) moves to Shigaraki, a pottery town in Shiga Prefecture, from Osaka. The eldest of three girls, she is a hardworking person who has supported her family (Sakuraba Nanami, Fukuda Mayuko, Kitamura Kazuki, Tomita Yasuko) since she was a child. Having grown up around Shigaraki ware, Kimiko eventually plunges into the male-dominated world of ceramics where she proceeds to blaze a trail as a pioneering female ceramic artist. She falls in love and gets married to her husband who is also a ceramic artist. United by their aspiration to be the ideal creative couple, they strive to create unique Shigaraki ware with their own kiln. She becomes a mother of two children and also cultivates many disciples.

Website: www.nhk.or.jp/scarlet

Preview: Scarlet Introduction

Oishii Kyushoku

Date: From 8.00 p.m., Mondays, 14 October 2019

Station: Tokyo MX

Scriptwriters: Nagamori Yuji (Nekonin Series, Nekozamurai Series), Ayabe Shinya, Taguchi Kei

Genre: Food comedy

Cast: Ichihara Hayato, Takeda Rena, Sato Taishi, Tsujimoto Tatsunori, Toyoshima Hana, Ito Maiko, Sako Yoshi

Synopsis: Amarida Yukio (Ichihara Hayato) is a teacher at Tokiwa Junior High School in the summer of 1984. He has a secret. That is, he will not forgive fellows who have no love for school meals because he loves them deep down in his heart. It is not an exaggeration to say that he came to school because of school meals. If it is known that a teacher looks forward to school meals more than his students, he will lose his dignity. However, one student throws down a challenge. The boy’s name is Go (Sato Taishi). This 13-year-old calls for change because he loves school meals. Who will enjoy the meal? A quiet “battle” between a teacher and student who are fanatic about school meals is about to begin.

Website: oishi-kyushoku.com

Preview: Oishii Kyushoku CM

Sherlock

Date: From 9.00 p.m., Mondays, 7 October 2019

Station: Fuji TV

Scriptwriter: Inoue Yumiko (Kinkyuu Torishirabeshitsu Series, Harassement Game, Pandora Series)

Original Work: Sherlock Holmes Series by Arthur Conan Doyle

Genre: Mystery

Cast: Dean Fujioka, Iwata Takanori, Yamada Maho, Matsumoto Marika, Yutaro, Sasaki Kuranosuke, Nakao Akiyoshi (guest star), Matsui Rena (guest star), Fuchikami Yasushi (guest star), Kinoshita Houka (guest star), Hiraizumi Sei (guest star), Kanno Miho (guest star), Kishii Yukino (guest star), Miura Toko (guest star), Ito Ayumi (guest star), Yano Masato (guest star), Kaneko Nobuaki (guest star), Hasegawa Kyoko (guest star)

Synopsis: Freelance crime consultant Sherlock Holmes (Dean Fujioka) has been fascinated with how people become criminals and with original sin since childhood. He is a genius who has cracked all sorts of cases from the time he was a student. However, he is a dangerous man with the impulse to commit crime and could turn into a criminal himself. Sherlock only takes on investigation requests from the police and individual clients that interest him. One day, he meets a psychiatrist Jon Watson (Iwata Takanori), who works at a hospital in Tokyo, through a case. At first, Watson comes away feeling that Sherlock is a haughty and insulting fellow. However, he gets comfortable with Sherlock’s personality as they work together and they team up to solve difficult cases.

Website: www.fujitv.co.jp/sherlock

Preview: Sherlock CM

Haru ~ Sougou Shousha no Onna

Date: From 10.00 p.m., Mondays, 21 October 2019

Station: TV Tokyo

Scriptwriters: Tatsui Yukari (Anata ni wa Watasanai, Koshiji Fubuki Monogatari, Mama to Papa ga Ikiru Riyuu), Honda Takaaki (Watashi Danna o Share Shiteta, Silent Voice, Daishou)

Genre: Corporate

Cast: Nakatani Miki, Fujiki Naohito, Shirasu Jin, Oshinari Shugo, Yamanaka Takashi, Kaji Masaki, Watanabe Kunito, Terada Kokoro, Okuda Eiji, Taguchi Hiromasa (guest star), Tanaka Yoji (guest star), Terada Minori (guest star), Kiriyama Ren (guest star), Kobayashi Takashi (guest star), Hasegawa Tomoharu (guest star), Matsuzawa Kazuyuki (guest star)

Synopsis: Single mother Umihara Haru (Nakatani Miki) was active in the American business community until she was directly headhunted by the CEO of Itsuki Trading, a leading Japanese general trading company, and returned to Japan. She takes up the deputy manager position in the elite Corporate Planning Department. But her direct superior turns out to be Wada Hisashi (Fujiki Naohito), the ex-husband whom she divorced 10 years ago. From ramen to rockets, Haru takes on all sorts of problems within Itsuki Trading’s enormous departments and affiliate companies. She proclaims that she wants to enjoy work and does things that defies common wisdom amid an atmosphere of paralysis due to a conservative deputy CEO.

Website: www.tv-tokyo.co.jp/haru

Preview: Haru ~ Sougou Shousha no Onna CM

Honki no Shirushi

Date: From 12.54 a.m., Tuesdays, 15 October 2019

Station: Nagoya TV

Scriptwriter: Mitani Shintaro

Original Work: Honki no Shirushi by Hoshisato Mochiru

Genre: Love suspense

Cast: Morisaki Win, Tsuchimura Kaho, Uno Shohei, Ishibashi Kei, Fukunaga Akari, Oshinari Shugo, Kitamura Yukiya

Synopsis: Tsuji Kazumichi (Morisaki Win) is an employee of a small trading company who has been drifting through daily life to ward off the sense of emptiness that he feels. He has a good reputation in the company and also seems to have a romantic relationship. However, he is neither good at endearing himself to other people nor developing feelings for others, and has never truly been in love. Then one day, Tsuji encounters a woman (Tsuchimura Kaho) with an aura of mystery at a convenience store and … …

Website: www.nagoyatv.com/honki

Black Kousoku

Date: From 12.59 a.m., Tuesdays, 15 October 2019 (followed by movie)

Station: NTV

Scriptwriter: Konomoto Kazuya (Setoutsumi)

Genre: School

Cast: Sato Shori, Takahashi Kaito, Motola Serena, Tanaka Juri, Yanai Yumena, Hotta Mayu, Aoi Yo, Mizusawa Rintaro, Tatsuma, Narumi Riko, Katayama Yuki, Yoshida Yasunao, Hoshida Hidetoshi, Tozuka Junki, Sakai Maki, Mitsuishi Ken, Denden

Synopsis: Onoda Sora (Sato Shori) is a second year high school student. All the students at his school have the same hairstyle, uniform, bag and shoes. There is not a hint of individuality. Their school life is governed by unreasonable and excessively strict rules which place emphasis on discipline. Sora who is virtually invisible at school, leads a lousy adolescence at the bottom of the class. His good friend Tsukioka Chuya (Takahashi Kaito) belongs to the same class and is the total opposite of Sora. Chuya does not read situations and his unpredictable behaviour always surprises those around him. There is a female student Machida Mao (Motola Serena) that the two of them are interested in. She cannot fit in at school and refuses to go to school because she is against dyeing the beautiful brown hair that she was born with to black. Sora and Chuya decide to crush their school’s unreasonable rules. Their decision soon develops into a situation that involves the whole school.

Website: https://www.ntv.co.jp/bla-kou/

Preview: Black Kousoku CM

Mada Kekkon Dekinai Otoko

Date: From 9.00 p.m., Tuesdays, 8 October 2019

Station: Fuji TV

Scriptwriter: Ozaki Masaya (Signal, Chinmoku Houtei, Kekkon Dekinai Otoko)

Genre: Romance

Cast: Abe Hiroshi, Yoshida Yo, Fukagawa Mai, Tsukamoto Takashi, Sakihi Miyu, Taira Yuna, Anami Atsuko, Nao, Arai Atsushi, Onodera Zuru, Mion, Fuwa Mansaku, Miura Rieko, Omi Toshinori, Inamori Izumi, Kusabue Mitsuko

Synopsis: Kuwano Shinsuke (Abe Hiroshi), a successful architect, is well-to-do, knowledgeable and good-looking. He is now 53, still lives alone in the same apartment, which has the latest gadgets, and enjoys single life. Although he fell for Hayasaka Natsumi, the doctor who treated him and changed his perspective toward marriage, and even dated, they later broke up. So Kuwano’s heart is shut firmly to love again. He is even more eccentric now, and feels a little anxious when he thinks about the future. One day, the wheels of fate start to move all of a sudden after a chance encounter with some women – the lawyer Yoshiyama Madoka (Yoshida Yo), new neighbour Tonami Saki (Fukagawa Mai), and cafe manager Okano Yukie (Inamori Izumi).

Website: www.ktv.jp/kekkondekinaiotoko

Preview: Mada Kekkon Dekinai Otoko CM

G Senjou no Anata to Watashi

Date: From 10.00 p.m., Tuesdays, 15 October 2019

Station: TBS

Scriptwriter: Adachi Naoko (Kinou Nani Tabeta?, Toumeina Yurikago, Dainbinbo)

Original Work: G Senjou no Anata to Watashi by Ikuemi Aya

Cast: Haru, Nakagawa Taishi, Sakurai Yuki, Suzuki Nobuyuki, Mao, Takizawa Karen, Morioka Ryu, Nagano Munenori, Konishi Haru, Iketani Nobue, Hino Yojin, Nagano Satomi, Shida Masayuki, Yazaki Yusa, Kizuki, Ogi Hiroaki, Natsuki Yoko, Matsushita Yuki

Synopsis: Kogure Yaeko (Haru) is about to resign from her company to get married when her fiance Murano Satoshi (Morioka Ryu) tells her that there is someone else that he likes and breaks off their engagement. A teary Yaeko staggers to a shopping mall in a daze. At the mall, she happens to hear a live performance of Bach’s Air on G String. Moved by the piece, she begins to take violin lessons for adults in the hopes of being able to play it. A university student Kase Rihito (Nakagawa Taishi) and housewife Kitagawa Yukie (Matsushita Yuki) are in the same class as Yaeko. Both interpersonal relationships and the violin prove difficult for the three of them to deal with.

Website: www.tbs.co.jp/gsenjou

Preview: G Senjou no Anata to Watashi CM

Hidarikiki no Eren

Date: From 1.28 a.m., Wednesdays, 23 October 2019

Station: TBS

Scriptwriter: Nemoto Nonji (Kansatsui Asagao, Fruits Takuhaibin, Izakaya Fuji)

Original Work: Hidarikiki no Eren by Kappi

Cast: Kamio Fuju, Ikeda Eliza, Ishizaki Huwie, Nakamura Yurika, Imaizumi Yui, Yoshimura Kaito, Tanaka Makoto, Kubota Sayu, Yagi Arisa, Itabashi Shunya, Maruyama Tomomi, Murasugi Seminosuke, Sakata Masanobu, Hannya, Horibe Keisuke

Synopsis: Asakura Koichi (Kamio Fuju) is a designer who works for a major advertising agency. But no matter how hard he works, he is buried among the many creators and will not get noticed by anyone. A frustrated Koichi visits a place where he remembers meeting the gifted Yamagishi Eren (Ikeda Eliza) back in high school, and recalls some incident. Meanwhile, Eren works as an artist called Southpaw in New York. Although she has talent that impresses others, she does not feel a compelling desire to draw anything and has been floundering. What lies ahead for Koichi who has ordinary ability but wants to become someone, and Eren who is gifted but is not living well?

Website: www.mbs.jp/eren_drama

Preview: Hidarikiki no Eren Teaser

Aibou Season 18

Date: From 9.00 p.m., Wednesdays, 9 October 2019 (for two seasons)

Station: TV Asahi

Scriptwriter: Koshimizu Yasuhiro (Aibou Series)

Genre: Detective

Cast: Mizutani Yutaka, Sorimachi Takashi, Kawahara Kazuhisa, Yamanaka Takashi, Yamanishi Atsushi, Asari Yosuke, Ashina Sei, Jinbo Satoshi, Sugimoto Tetta, Nakama Yukie, Ishizaka Koji, Funakoshi Eiichiro (guest star), Kimura Yoshino (guest star), Kita Kana (guest star), Dan Jiro (guest star)

Synopsis: Detective Sugishita Ukyo (Mizutani Yutaka) is supposed to have finished his customary trip to London. However, he has been absent from work for one week. His mobile phone is turned off and he also does not return calls despite the voice messages left for him. His partner Kaburagi Wataru (Sorimachi Takashi) and the people around Ukyo are anxious about his safety. Aoki Toshio (Asari Yosuke), an officer with the cyber security task force, investigates. He learns that Ukyo returned to Japan a week ago but is not able to trace him after that. Meanwhile, Wataru is called to the Akita Prefectural Police. For some reason, Ukyo’s mobile phone is in a polystyrene foam container and it washed up on the shores of the prefecture … …

Website: www.tv-asahi.co.jp/aibou

Douki no Sakura

Date: From 10.00 p.m., Wednesdays, 9 October 2019

Station: NTV

Scriptwriter: Yukawa Kazuhiko (Haken Uranaishi Ataru, Kahogo no Kahoko Series, Gisou Fuufu)

Cast: Takahata Mitsuki, Hashimoto Ai, Arata Mackenyu, Ryusei Ryo, Okayama Amane, Tsukayama Masane, Kusakawa Takuya, Ono Ito, Aibu Saki, Shiina Kippei

Synopsis: Kitano Sakura (Takahata Mitsuki) hails from a small, sparsely populated northern island. She is a new employee of Hanamura Construction, the largest construction company, in the spring of 2009. At the welcome ceremony for newcomers, she announces to the CEO, “My dream is to build a bridge that joins my hometown to mainland!” Sakura single-mindedly charges toward her dream. However, her inability to consider the feelings of others causes unexpected situations and throws a wrench into the works. She sticks to her principles despite adversity and gradually inspires her colleagues, who are initially lukewarm, to get involved.

Website: www.ntv.co.jp/sakura2019

Preview: Douki no Sakura CM

Shinya Shokudo ~ Tokyo Stories Season 2

Date: From 31 October 2019

Network: Netflix Japan

Scriptwriters: Manabe Katsuhiko (Shinya Shokudo Series), Mukai Kosuke (Shinya Shokudo Seasons 1 – 3), Kojima Kensaku (Shinya Shokudo ~ Tokyo Stories Season 1,) Oshima Mari

Original Work: Shinya Shokudo by Abe Yaro

Genre: Food

Cast: Kobayashi Kaoru, Fuwa Mansaku, Ayata Toshiki, Ando Tamae, Matsushige Yutaka, Yo Kimiko, Odagiri Joe, Nakamura Toru (guest star), Emoto Akira (guest star), Emoto Tasuku (guest star), Katsuji Ryo (guest star), Nagayama Kento (guest star), Joseph Chang (guest star)

Synopsis: There is a small eatery ‘Meshiya’ in a back alley of a busy street which is run just by its owner (Kobayashi Kaoru). Called the “midnight eatery”, its opening hours are from midnight to 7 am in the morning. The only items on the menu of are miso soup with pork and vegetables set, beer, sake and shochu. All sorts of customers visit the eatery which is based on the owner’s policy of “making whatever can be done”. The encounters between the owner, food and customers are humorous and at times heartrending.

Website: www.meshiya.tv

Preview: Shinya Shokudo ~ Tokyo Stories Season 2 CM

Shiyakusho

Date: From 12.12 a.m., Thursdays, 17 October 2019

Station: TV Tokyo

Scriptwriters: Masaike Yosuke (Miki Clinic de Kanpai o, Zettai Seigi, Miss Sherlock), Miura Kisa (Watashi Danna o Share Shiteta), Karasuma Natsume

Original Work: Shiyakusho by Azumi Kishi

Cast: Matsuoka Masahiro, Kuroshima Yuina, Kiyohara Sho, Matsumoto Marika, Denden, Oriyama Nao (guest star), Sakai Wakana (guest star), Nomaguchi Toru (guest star), Miura Takahiro (guest star), Toyoshima Hana (guest star), Yo Kimiko (guest star), Miura Takahiro (guest star)

Synopsis: The first place that departed souls visit is the Death Office. This office determines the destinations of those who have died of various reasons such as suicide, murder, illness and accidents. Shimura (Matsuoka Masahiro) is a staff at the Death Office’s General Information Desk and he treats the endless stream of dead people who show up with feigned politeness. They range from those who accept death to those who do not grasp reality. Their behaviour while they were alive is revealed by their application forms. The innocent go to heaven while the guilty go to hell. In fact, the staff (Kuroshima Yuina, Kiyohara Sho, Matsumoto Marika, Denden) of the Death Office have a secret. Why do they end up working in this place after death? And what is Shimura’s secret past?

Website: www.tv-tokyo.co.jp/shiyakusho

Preview: Shiyakusho CM

Million Joe

Date: From 1.35 a.m., Thursdays, 10 October 2019

Station: TV Tokyo

Scriptwriter: Masaike Yosuke (Miki Clinic de Kanpai o, Zettai Seigi, Miss Sherlock)

Original Work: Million Joe by Juguchi Ryoji

Genre: Comedy suspense

Cast: Kitayama Hiromitsu, Hagiwara Masato, Imaizumi Yui, Fukami Motoki, Nagano, Miura Masaki, Takeda Kohei, Tsuda Kanji, Sugawara Daikichi, Okada Koki (guest star), Kinoshita Houka (guest star), Kusakari Mayu (guest star), Watanabe Hiroyuki (guest star)

Synopsis: Kurei Soichi (Kitayama Hiromitsu) gave up on his dream to be a manga artist and is now the editor in charge of the huge hit manga Million Joe at manga magazine Shukan Shonen Glory’s editorial department. However, he is unmotivated and has no love for the manga. One day, Magata Tsuneo (Miura Masaki), the eccentric author who created Million Joe, dies all of a sudden. Believing that the widely popular Million Joe, which has avid fans all over the world, cannot be left uncompleted, Kurei hides Magata’s death. He persuades Magata’s trusted chief assistant Terashi Ryota (Hagiwara Masato) who draws the pictures, and makes a shocking suggestion. They will try to continue the series based on the creative notes that Magata left behind. But will they be able to fool the fans and spin the story with new characters?

Website: www.tv-tokyo.co.jp/millionjoe

Preview: Million Joe CM

Doctor X ~ Gekai Daimon Michiko Season 6

Date: From 9.00 p.m., Thursdays, 17 October 2019

Station: TV Asahi

Scriptwriters: Nakazono Miho (Sego-don, Doctor X Series, Hatsukoi), Hayashi Makoto (Doctor X Seasons 2 – 5, Isan Sozoku Bengoshi Kakizaki Shinichi, Strawberry Night)

Cast: Yonekura Ryoko, Santamaria Yusuke, Uchida Yuki, Endo Kenichi, Katsumura Masanobu, Suzuki Kosuke, Takeda Shinji, Shimizu Michiko, Fujimori Shingo, Imada Mio, Tozuka Junki, Kawakita Mayuko, Kawase Riko, Kishibe Ittoku, Ichimura Masachika, Nishida Toshiyuki, Matsuzaka Keiko (guest star)

Synopsis: Totei University Hospital faces a huge deficit like never before as the medical community is inundated by a host of challenges such as balancing the next generation with an authoritarian generation, and also coexisting with computers and AI close in. An investor Nicholas Tange, with the nickname Vulture, arrives at this “white tower” which is on the verge of bankruptcy. Tange, who is one of the best professionals in the world for corporate restructuring, puts Totei University Hospital on the path to a turnaround as part of his plan. However, this also forces a rationalisation of medical care, and the hospital is faced with the reality of restructuring and cost-cutting. With business now taking top priority, the hospital transforms into a ground for politics and power struggles. Daimon Michiko (Yonekura Ryoko) is summoned by Tange and comes to Totei University Hospital. She fights a solitary battle once again as a new power game intensifies.

Website: www.tv-asahi.co.jp/doctor-x

Related: Doctor X ~ Gekai Daimon Michiko Season 5

Motokare Mania

Date: From 10.00 p.m., Thursdays, 17 October 2019

Station: Fuji TV

Scriptwriter: Tsubota Fumi (Kounodori Series, Onna Michi, Heat)

Original Work: Motokare Mania by Takinami Yukari

Genre: Love comedy

Cast: Kora Kengo, Araki Yuko, Hamano Kenta, Tanaka Minami, Yoshiko, Morita Kanro, Sekiguchi Mandy, Kato Toranosuke, Daichi, Inoue Shota, Shuri, Kote Shinya, Yamaguchi Sayaka

Synopsis: Nanba Yukari (Araki Yuko), a 27-year-old office lady, is not unattractive or inferior to the girls around her. Nevertheless, her romantic relationships have not gone well. She cannot forget her ex-boyfriend Saito Makoto (Kora Kengo) whom she nicknamed Makochi. She loves him so much that she looks up his name on social media every morning, has imaginary conversations with him and looks ecstatic when she finds faint similarities in the men she meets for the first time through the “ex-boyfriend scouter” that she activated. Makoto vanished after the two of them broke up five years ago. However, they are reunited as colleagues at the real estate company where Yukari works. He stirs up Yukari with his words and actions without realising. Meanwhile, Yukari’s first client Yamashita Akio (Hamano Kenta), a salaryman with a promising future at a leading food company, proposes that they date … …

Website: www.fujitv.co.jp/motokaremania

Cheat ~ Sagishi no Minnasan, Gochuui Kudasai

Date: From 11.59 p.m., Thursdays, 3 October 2019

Station: NTV

Scriptwriters: Matsumoto Miyoko (Seigi no Se, Koi ga Heta de mo Ikitemasu, Higanbana), Yamashita Subaru (1-page no Koi)

Cast: Honda Tsubasa, Kaneko Daichi, Uesugi Shuhei, Fukuhara Haruka, Tomita Miu, Yokota Mayu, Kiyohara Sho, Ikeuchi Mansaku, Kiriyama Ren, Kazama Shunsuke

Synopsis: 25-year-old Hoshino Saki (Honda Tsubasa) is the brains of a mysterious specialist team called CHEAT, which deceives and exposes swindlers in return. Gifted with the ability to read people’s minds, she brilliantly corners them. However, she is actually a struggling third-rate idol with the stage name Kisaragi Momo. As far as Saki is concerned, this is her main profession. She was scouted by detective Anzai Kazuki (Kazama Shunsuke) and joined CHEAT in order to earn a living. Because the talent agency that Saki belongs to does not permit idols to work part-time, she cannot let anyone know about her activities with CHEAT. At the same time, she keeps her idol status a secret from the members of CHEAT. She pursues her dream of becoming a top idol while engaging in mind games with swindlers.

Website: www.ytv.co.jp/cheat

Preview: Cheat Teaser

Ai Naki Mori de Sakebi

Date: From 11 October 2019

Network: Netflix Japan

Scriptwriter: Sono Sion (Tokyo Vampire Hotel, Minna ESPer dayo! Series, Jikou Keisatsu Series)

Genre: Suspense

Cast: Shiina Kippei, Mitsushima Shinnosuke, Denden, Hinami Kyoko, Kamataki Eri, Matobu Sei

Synopsis: Murata Jo (Shiina Kippei) is a ruthless criminal. On the surface, he is cheerful and lively. But he emotionally controls other people, milks them for money and makes them commit brutal crimes.

Website: www.netflix.com/jp/title/81133621

Preview: Ai Naki Mori de Sakebi CM

Jigoku no Girlfriend

Date: From 25 October 2019 (updated every Friday)

Network: Fuji on Demand

Scriptwriter: Kurosawa Hisako (Otto no Chinpo ga Hairanai, Minshuu no Teki, Arechi no Koi)

Original Work: Jigoku no Girlfriend by Torikai Akane

Cast: Kato Rosa, Takeda Rina, Izuka Kenta, Kamimura Kaisei, Ochiai Motoki, Kikawada Masaya, Sakurai Yuki

Synopsis: A divorced single mother Shimada Kana (Kato Rosa) who is a web writer, a single company employee Shudo Yuri (Takeda Rina) and a very popular and beautiful jewellery designer Deguchi Nao (Sakurai Yuki) start sharing an apartment. While the three of them have totally different personalities, jobs and status, they soon get on terms where they can voice the feelings and troubles that they have never been able to tell anyone.

Website: www.fujitv.co.jp/jigogaa

Preview: Jigoku no Girlfriend CM

Aozakura Bouei Daigakkou Monogatari

Date: From 12.59 a.m., Fridays, 1 November 2019

Station: TBS

Scriptwriters: Yoshida Erika (Heaven? Gokuraku Restaurant, Hana Nochi Hare, Dansui!), Miyamoto Takeshi (Prison Hotel, Byplayers Season 1)

Original Work: Aozakura Bouei Daigakkou Monogatari by Nikaido Hikaru

Genre: School

Cast: Hongo Kanata, Yuki Kousei, Ozawa Ren, Kozono Ryo, Takasaki Shota, Isaka Tatsuya, Kanou Kento

Synopsis: Kondo Isami (Hongo Kanata), a third-year high school student, has good grades but he is forced to decide which path to take because of his family’s financial situation. One day, he learns about the government-affiliated Defence Academy where students are not only exempt from admission fees and school fees, but are given an allowance every month. He wishes to go to this academy. After graduating from high school, Kondo enters the Defence Academy and meets Matsuhira Yosuke (Kanou Kento), Okita Soji (Ozawa Ren), Harada Tadashi (Yuki Kousei) and Takei Tomoaki (Kozono Ryo) who become friends. He takes the first step to a new life, but when the entrance ceremony ends, the attitudes of the senior students including Sakaki Ryuya (Takasaki Shota) and Nishiwaki Takashi (Isaka Tatsuya) change drastically and strict coaching begins

Website: www.mbs.jp/aozakura

Preview: Aozakura CM

Nee Sensei, Shiranai no?*NEW*

Date: From 12.59 a.m., Fridays, 6 December 2019

Station: TBS

Scriptwriter: Shimoda Yuko (Coffee & Vanilla, Bungaku Shojo)

Original Work: Nee Sensei, Shiranai no? by Asano Aya

Genre: Romance

Cast: Baba Fumika, Akaso Eiji, Yahagi Honoka, Wada Masanari, Furukawa Tsuyoshi, Miyase Ryubi, Tanda Hazuki

Synopsis: Aoi Hana (Baba Fumika) is a popular manga artist with practically no experience in romance. One day, she happens to enter a hair salon and falls in love at first sight with a handsome hairstylist Kido Riichi (Akaso Eiji). They end up dating. Hana completely forgets about her new boyfriend when she goes into work mode and this makes her a failure of a girlfriend. However, Riichi loves it that Hana is such a workaholic?!

Website: www.mbs.jp/nee_sensei/

Shinmai Shimai no Futari Gohan

Date: From 1.00 a.m., Fridays, 11 October 2019

Station: TV Tokyo

Scriptwriters: Seki Erika (Strawberry Night Saga, Gosaigyou, Ima kara Anata o Kyohaku Shimasu), Imanishi Yuko (Izakaya Fuji), Soma Hikaru

Original Work: Shinmai Shimai no Futari Gohan by Hiiragi Yutaka

Genre: Food

Cast: Yamada Anna, Otomo Karen, Tanaka Mei, Imo Haruka, Ashina Sei

Synopsis: Sachi (Yamada Anna) and Ayari (Otomo Karen) become sisters all of a sudden when their parents remarry. The two of them have to live together after their newly wed parents set off immediately for an overseas trip. However, Sachi gets scared of Ayari who does not say much and gives her piercing looks. She is feeling very anxious about life under the same roof when they receive ham from their parents. Ayari briefly glances at a bewildered Sachi before she begins prepare the ham. This helps the two of them to start opening up to each other and their bond as sisters deepen through cooking.

Website: www.tv-tokyo.co.jp/shinmai

Tokumei Keiji Kakuho no Onna Season 2

Date: From 8.00 p.m., Fridays, 18 October 2019

Network: TV Tokyo

Scriptwriter: Hata Takehiko (Soshite Daremo Inakunatta, Danda Rin, Unfair Series)

Genre: Detective

Cast: Natori Yuko, Aso Yumi, Daito Shunsuke, Masana Bokuzo, Onozuka Hayato, Hasegawa Hatsunori, Takahashi Katsunori (guest star), Kato Masaya, Wada Masato (guest star), Miyakawa Ichirota (guest star), Kusumi Koharu (guest star), Matsuo Yuji (guest star)

Synopsis: Miura Aya (Aso Yumi) has been feeling depressed even though she was given a promotion, and assigned from Kanagawa Prefectural Police headquarters to a police precinct as a deputy police chief. However, this is only a job title. In reality, all she has been doing is counter work. Hojo Yuriko (Natori Yuko) retired but has returned as a part-time detective. This odd pair who are like oil and water team up once again. Freed from the constraints of the police organisation in their current positions, they run riot.

Synopsis: 25-year-old Hanamaki Mikoto (Fukushi Sota) is a paramedic with the special ability to see the final moments of the person whose hand is in his, and there is a sober reality that he cannot tell anyone about. Mikoto’s mother died when he was a child and after that, his father remarried. The three children (Nanao, Kiritani Kenta, Yokohama Ryusei) from his stepmother’s (Aso Yumi) previous marriage became his family. Mikoto has secretly had feelings for his older step sister Sara (Nanao) who lives under the same roof. However, at one time, he ends up seeing that Sara would die on her 28th birthday. Wishing for her happiness, Mikoto desperately considers how to save her life. But the visions he has had so far have all come true despite him trying all he can as a paramedic. Nevertheless, can he change this cruel destiny precisely because he has this special ability? As Mikoto tries to do so, he gets overwhelmed by his feelings for Sara which he has kept to himself.

Synopsis: Amano Manako (Matsuyuki Yasuko) is a professor at a top university’s faculty of engineering. She is currently researching the science of failure. Her studies are not to examine the responsibility for failure, but to determine direct, situational and social factors, and turn it into knowledge to help prevent a recurrence. There are always some mistakes in the various types of accidents that occur daily and accident investigation is the best fieldwork for Manako. This activity goes beyond the boundaries of engineering and she follows wherever her curiosity takes her. Her conviction is that “Growth and progress always accompany failure”. Manako loves mistakes and because her eyes sparkle at stories of failure, this irritates other people. However, she is able to arrive at the truth of an accident through the database of failures from all ages and cultures that she has internalised.

Synopsis: Kiriyama Shuichiro (Odagiri Joe) returns to Japan after a 12-year secondment to the FBI in the US, and rejoins the Statute of Limitation Management Division at Sobu Police Precinct. The primary job of this division is to send documents on cases where the statue of limitations have run out to the prosecution, and to manage these investigation materials. However, ever since the statue of limitation was abolished for serious cases such as murders, the division has become more redundant than ever. Kiriyama returns to his old haunt and gets started on his hobby again with his assistant Mikazuki Shizuka (Aso Kumiko). It is to personally investigate cases where the statute of limitation is expiring. He is not particularly concerned about identifying the criminal or the size of the cases. All he wants to do is to make sure his deductions are correct.

Haruta, the unpopular, written-off bachelor who is good-natured, straightforward, kind and a wee bit of a fool, enjoys an unexpected period of popularity. However, they are all male, whether pilot, copilot or mechanic, for some reason! Kurosawa Musashi (Yoshida Kotaro) is a great captain with exceptional expertise and personality. Many people have faith in Kurosawa and even Haruta admires him. Kurosawa is strict about work and keen in mentoring his juniors. In the course of the flights with Haruta, Kurosawa sees his passion and the efforts he makes for passengers, and gradually acknowledges him. At some point, this turns to love.

His love for his mother Mitsuko (Inoue Mao) and Sakura shaped him as a person. No matter how irresponsible and wild he was, he never had any ill will towards people and was a fair person. Yohei’s younger brother Shigeru (Tsurumi Shingo) and Yohei’s physician Masaki Shohei (Yoshida Eisaku) become central to the cover-up operation to make it look like a robbery and murder. Synopsis: Matsuoka Naoki (Tamayama Tetsuji) is a journalist who has worked for the business desk of Daiwa Shimbun, a major Tokyo-based newspaper publisher, for 15 years. One day, he is told that he is being transferred to the political desk for a year. Matsuoka caught the attention of Chief Cabinet Secretary Kondo (Kobayashi Kaoru) when he disregarded the rules and posed the question, “What do you think about the safe discovered in a landfill in Minato ward?” at the Chief Cabinet Secretary’s first scheduled briefing. He rises to the top of the league in a flash. Meanwhile, Sakai Yuji (Ikeuchi Hiroyuki), a weekly magazine reporter who used to be Matsuoka’s colleague, has been pursuing the truth of the safe found in the landfill. Then a robbery takes place. The victim is someone whom Sakai had just interviewed regarding the safe. Matsuoka and Sakai have gone along different paths as reporters. However, they meet again after 10 years, and the biggest taboo in the official residence which rocks the country’s political centre is gradually exposed.

Actually, anyone who blocks her marriage will end up becoming her enemy. She will do everything she can to get the man she loves. Rika’s first target is Oya Masashi (Koike Teppei), a surgeon. He has a fiancee and everything is going well for him until he meets Rika who has been hired as a nurse. This is all part of her plot. Mysterious incidents keep happening at the hospital and patients, nurses as well as doctors vanish. Then Rika also gets her clutches on Oya’s fiancee … … Three years later, Honma Takao (Otani Ryohei) becomes Rika’s second target. Honma is living apart from his wife Yoko (Tokunaga Eri) and their 7-year-old daughter because of Yoko’s infidelity. He makes the acquaintance of a woman who uses the name Rika through a matchmaking app and suggests that they meet. Honma’s colleagues, wife and daughter and even detectives get entangled.

Genre: Detective

Cast: Kaku Kento, Hirosue Ryoko, Iura Arata, Kitamura Kazuki, Kaho, Kudo Asuka, Takahashi Hikaru, Tachibana Eri, Sakuma Yui, Tanoi Ken, Hosoda Yoshihiko, Sasai Eisuke, Eishin, Sugimoto Tetta, Sasano Takashi

Synopsis: Yusa Kiyoharu (Kaku Kento) from the Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department is a cool-headed detective who is in charge of investigations on the frontline and will do whatever it takes to achieve his objectives. One day, when he wakes up in a forest, he finds a gun in his right hand, and a dead female detective, Usui Kaoru (Hirosue Ryoko), lying beside him … … This woman was his superior. Did he kill her or was he set up by someone? There is a gap of several months in his memory. Yusa’s buddies turn enemies overnight and he is pursued as a murder suspect. His only partner is a boy who is the female detective’s only son, Katsuki (Tanoi Ken). Eventually, the case gets linked with the truth of the unsolved 1 billion yen heist.

Website: www.ntv.co.jp/NNY

Preview: Nippon Noir CM

Aku no Hadou ~ Satsujin Bunseki-han Spin-off

Date: From 10.30 p.m., Sundays, 6 October 2019

Network: WOWOW

Scriptwriter: Shimizu Masashi (Mushikago no Jomae, Otoko Meshi)

Original Work: Ishi no Mayu Keishichou Satsujin Bunseki-han by Asami Kazushi

Genre: Crime suspense

Cast: Furukawa Yuki, Sumire, Fukazawa Tatsuya, Hirano Kinari, Chiba Tetsuya, Anan Kenji, Nikaido Satoshi, Tsurumi Shingo, Ikeda Tetsuhiro, Kimura Fumino

Synopsis: In 2014, a series of murders targeting women takes place in Kawasaki City. All the victims have been killed as if they had hanged and these are dubbed the “Hanging Murders” in public. The police investigation runs into difficulties without clues on the murderer. However, Detective Iguchi Tomokazu (Ikeda Tetsuhiro) from the First Investigation Division, has his eye on a man whom he suspects to kill for pleasure. This man is Nogi Naoya (Furukawa Yuki). He lies about his identity, erases his traces in public and lives as if he is holding his breath. Nogi is actually Yaginuma Masato, the victim in the sensational Akishima mother and son kidnapping case. He gets his neighbour Asada Yoshika (Sumire) involved as he tries to escape the police dragnet but comes to realise some facts. What is his true motive?

Website: www.wowow.co.jp/dramaw/hadou
